head.supplied: It may interest you to know that my Govt Botanist an exceedingly clever & active german Dr Muëller — is still on a tour which he undertook in the autumn over parts of the main dividing range between G...

div.p: FromCharles La Trobe to Ronald Gunn
A249 Gunn correspondence, Mitchell Library,State Library of New South Wales,Sydney.

It may interest you to know that my Govt Botanist an exceedingly clever & active german Dr Muëller — is still on a tour which he undertook in the autumn over parts of the main dividing range between Gipps Land & the Ovens & other confluents of the Murray. To the NW. I see from a letter—dated Alberton — that he was winding up by exploring Wilsons promontory. He tells me that has already added 1030 new species to his collection including some very remarkable plants.
I shall publish in due time reports of his proceedings which shall be forwarded to you —
